question: Two similar galvanometers are covered into an ammeter and a milliammeter. The shunt resistance of ammeter as compared to the shunt resistance of milliammeter will be
explanation: For Ammeter, range I is large (e.g., 1A). For Milliammeter, range I is small (e.g., 1mA).
Since <katex>$S \propto \frac{1}{I}$</katex> approximately, larger range requires smaller shunt.
Therefore, Ammeter (larger range) has Less shunt resistance.
